page.title: 13Cotswold Stone Quarrying (4)
page.content: Dumper trucks load the stone at the quarry face into an enormous truck which holds 25 tons and carries 15,00 tons a day. It travels at 35 miles an hour across the quarry to the crusher. The crusher operator signals when he is ready for the lorry to tip its load into the chute. The mighty hammers inside the crusher demolish the massive stones into small bits which travel up a conveyor onto a big metal sheet screen which has holes in it. This separator sorts the stones into correct sizes and they fall into a bin. Lorries drive under the bins to load up with small stones. There are chains to open and shut the hoppers. There are six bins, various conveyors and sorting machinery including a washing drum. Pressed concrete bricks are made using surplus products. 2500 bricks per hour are made.
